--- title: "Welcome To My Blog" description: "blog post description (appears underneath the title in smaller text) which is included on the listing page" author: "Alireza Chamanzar" date: "2024-07-26" categories: [Tidytuesday] --- This is the first and offcourse automate post in a My R+Quarto blog. Welcome! ![](thumbnail.jpg) # TidyTuesday Chanlenge \| 2024-08-06 ## Load library ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.1 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library("plotly") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'plotly' The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': last_plot The following object is masked from 'package:stats': filter The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': layout ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library("leaflet") library("highcharter") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': method from as.zoo.data.frame zoo ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library("htmlwidgets") ``` ::: ## Load Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} olympics <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-08-06/olympics.csv') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Rows: 271116 Columns: 15 ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr (10): name, sex, team, noc, games, season, city, sport, event, medal dbl (5): id, age, height, weight, year ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. ``` ::: ::: ## Check dataset ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(olympics) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` id name sex age Min. : 1 Length:271116 Length:271116 Min. :10.00 1st Qu.: 34643 Class :character Class :character 1st Qu.:21.00 Median : 68205 Mode :character Mode :character Median :24.00 Mean : 68249 Mean :25.56 3rd Qu.:102097 3rd Qu.:28.00 Max. :135571 Max. :97.00 NA's :9474 height weight team noc Min. :127.0 Min. : 25.0 Length:271116 Length:271116 1st Qu.:168.0 1st Qu.: 60.0 Class :character Class :character Median :175.0 Median : 70.0 Mode :character Mode :character Mean :175.3 Mean : 70.7 3rd Qu.:183.0 3rd Qu.: 79.0 Max. :226.0 Max. :214.0 NA's :60171 NA's :62875 games year season city Length:271116 Min. :1896 Length:271116 Length:271116 Class :character 1st Qu.:1960 Class :character Class :character Mode :character Median :1988 Mode :character Mode :character Mean :1978 3rd Qu.:2002 Max. :2016 sport event medal Length:271116 Length:271116 Length:271116 Class :character Class :character Class :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Gender equality over time gender_data <- olympics %>% group_by(year, sex) %>% summarise(count = n_distinct(name)) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(gender_data, aes(x = year, y = count, fill = sex)) + geom_area() + labs(title = "Gender Distribution in Olympics Over Time", x = "Year", y = "Number of Athletes", fill = "Gender") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave("gender_distribution.png", width = 10, height = 6) # Top countries' medal counts top_countries <- olympics %>% filter(!is.na(medal)) %>% group_by(team) %>% summarise(total_medals = n()) %>% arrange(desc(total_medals)) %>% head(10) %>% pull(team) country_medals <- olympics %>% filter(team %in% top_countries, !is.na(medal)) %>% group_by(year, team) %>% summarise(medal_count = n()) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplotly(ggplot(country_medals, aes(x = year, y = medal_count, color = team)) + geom_line() + geom_point() + labs(title = "Top 5 Countries' Medal Counts Over Time", x = "Year", y = "Number of Medals", color = "Country") + theme_minimal()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave("top_countries_medals.png", width = 10, height = 6) print("Plots have been generated and saved as 'gender_distribution.png' and 'top_countries_medals.png'.") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Plots have been generated and saved as 'gender_distribution.png' and 'top_countries_medals.png'." ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Gender equality over time gender_data <- olympics %>% group_by(year, sex) %>% summarise(count = n_distinct(name)) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} gender_chart <- highchart() %>% hc_chart(type = "area") %>% hc_title(text = "Gender Distribution in Olympics Over Time") %>% hc_xAxis(title = list(text = "Year")) %>% hc_yAxis(title = list(text = "Number of Athletes")) %>% hc_plotOptions(area = list(stacking = "percent")) %>% hc_add_series(data = gender_data %>% filter(sex == "M"), name = "Male", hcaes(x = year, y = count)) %>% hc_add_series(data = gender_data %>% filter(sex == "F"), name = "Female", hcaes(x = year, y = count)) %>% hc_colors(c("#1f77b4", "#ff7f0e")) %>% hc_tooltip(shared = TRUE, valueSuffix = " athletes") # Gender equality by country (top 10 countries by total participants) top_countries <- olympics %>% group_by(team) %>% summarise(total = n_distinct(name)) %>% arrange(desc(total)) %>% head(10) %>% pull(team) country_gender_data <- olympics %>% filter(team %in% top_countries) %>% group_by(team, sex) %>% summarise(count = n_distinct(name)) %>% ungroup() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'team'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} country_gender_chart <- highchart() %>% hc_chart(type = "bar") %>% hc_title(text = "Gender Distribution in Top 10 Countries") %>% hc_xAxis(categories = top_countries) %>% hc_yAxis(title = list(text = "Percentage"), labels = list(format = "{value}%")) %>% hc_plotOptions(bar = list(stacking = "percent")) %>% hc_add_series(data = country_gender_data %>% filter(sex == "M"), name = "Male", hcaes(x = team, y = count)) %>% hc_add_series(data = country_gender_data %>% filter(sex == "F"), name = "Female", hcaes(x = team, y = count)) %>% hc_colors(c("#1f77b4", "#ff7f0e")) %>% hc_tooltip(shared = TRUE, valueSuffix = "%") gender_chart ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} country_gender_chart ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Save the charts as HTML files #saveWidget(gender_chart, "gender_distribution_highchart.html", selfcontained = TRUE) #saveWidget(country_gender_chart, "country_gender_distribution_highchart.html", selfcontained = TRUE) #print("Interactive Highcharts have been generated and saved as 'gender_distribution_highchart.html' and 'country_gender_distribution_highchart.html'.") ``` :::
